P20.name: place of death
P20.desc: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) death location of a person, animal or fictional character

P54.name: member of sports team
P54.desc: sports teams or clubs that the subject represents or represented

P495.name: country of origin
P495.desc: country of origin of this item (creative work, food, phrase, product, etc.)

P31.name: instance of
P31.desc: that class of which this subject is a particular example and member; different from P279 (subclass of); for example: K2 is an instance of mountain; volcano is a subclass of mountain (and an instance of volcanic landform)

P1412.name: languages spoken, written or signed
P1412.desc: language(s) that a person or a people speaks, writes or signs, including the native language(s)

P106.name: occupation
P106.desc: occupation of a person; see also "field of work" (Property:P101), "position held" (Property:P39)

P47.name: shares border with
P47.desc: countries or administrative subdivisions, of equal level, that this item borders, either by land or water. A single common point is enough.

P172.name: ethnic group
P172.desc: subject's ethnicity (consensus is that a VERY high standard of proof is needed for this field to be used. In general this means 1) the subject claims it themselves, or 2) it is widely agreed on by scholars, or 3) is fictional and portrayed as such)

P3373.name: sibling
P3373.desc: the subject and the object have the same parents (brother, sister, etc.); use "relative" (P1038) for siblings-in-law (brother-in-law, sister-in-law, etc.) and step-siblings (step-brothers, step-sisters, etc.)

P19.name: place of birth
P19.desc: most specific known (e.g. city instead of country, or hospital instead of city) birth location of a person, animal or fictional character

P27.name: country of citizenship
P27.desc: the object is a country that recognizes the subject as its citizen

P413.name: position played on team / speciality
P413.desc: position or specialism of a player on a team

P118.name: league
P118.desc: league in which team or player plays or has played in

P36.name: capital
P36.desc: seat of government of a country, province, state or other type of administrative territorial entity

P17.name: country
P17.desc: sovereign state of this item (not to be used for human beings)

P119.name: place of burial
P119.desc: location of grave, resting place, place of ash-scattering, etc. (e.g., town/city or cemetery) for a person or animal. There may be several places: e.g., re-burials, parts of body buried separately.

P190.name: twinned administrative body
P190.desc: twin towns, sister cities, twinned municipalities and other localities that have a partnership or cooperative agreement, either legally or informally acknowledged by their governments

P1344.name: participant in
P1344.desc: event in which a person or organization was/is a participant; inverse of P710 or P1923

P108.name: employer
P108.desc: person or organization for which the subject works or worked

P286.name: head coach
P286.desc: on-field manager or head coach of a sports club (not to be confused with a general manager P505, which is not a coaching position) or person

P102.name: member of political party
P102.desc: the political party of which a person is or has been a member or otherwise affiliated

P272.name: production company
P272.desc: company that produced this film, audio or performing arts work

P131.name: located in the administrative territorial entity
P131.desc: the item is located on the territory of the following administrative entity. Use P276 for specifying locations that are non-administrative places and for items about events. Use P1382 if the item falls only partially into the administrative entity.

P86.name: composer
P86.desc: person(s) who wrote the music [for lyricist, use "lyrics by" (P676)]

P161.name: cast member
P161.desc: actor in the subject production [use "character role" (P453) and/or "name of the character role" (P4633) as qualifiers] [use "voice actor" (P725) for voice-only role]

P150.name: contains the administrative territorial entity
P150.desc: (list of) direct subdivisions of an administrative territorial entity

P37.name: official language
P37.desc: language designated as official by this item

P166.name: award received
P166.desc: award or recognition received by a person, organization or creative work

P463.name: member of
P463.desc: organization, club or musical group to which the subject belongs. Do not use for membership in ethnic or social groups, nor for holding a political position, such as a member of parliament (use P39 for that).

P1303.name: instrument
P1303.desc: musical instrument that a person plays or teaches or used in a music occupation

P136.name: genre
P136.desc: creative work's genre or an artist's field of work (P101). Use main subject (P921) to relate creative works to their topic

P184.name: doctoral advisor
P184.desc: person who supervised the doctorate or PhD thesis of the subject

P1196.name: manner of death
P1196.desc: general circumstances of a person's death; e.g. natural causes, accident, suicide, homicide, etc.  Use 'cause of death' (P509) for the specific physiological mechanism, e.g. heart attack, trauma, pneumonia...

P103.name: native language
P103.desc: language or languages a person has learned from early childhood

P39.name: position held
P39.desc: subject currently or formerly holds the object position or public office

P26.name: spouse
P26.desc: the subject has the object as their spouse (husband, wife, partner, etc.). Use "unmarried partner" (P451) for non-married companions

P412.name: voice type
P412.desc: person's voice type. expected values: soprano, mezzo-soprano, contralto, countertenor, tenor, baritone, bass (and derivatives)

P735.name: given name
P735.desc: first name or another given name of this person; values used with the property should not link disambiguations nor family names

P58.name: screenwriter
P58.desc: person(s) who wrote the script for subject item

P1411.name: nominated for
P1411.desc: award nomination received by a person, organisation or creative work (inspired from "award received" (Property:P166))

P101.name: field of work
P101.desc: specialization of a person or organization; see P106 for the occupation

P140.name: religion or worldview
P140.desc: religion of a person, organization or religious building, or associated with this subject

P364.name: original language of film or TV show
P364.desc: language in which a film or a performance work was originally created. Deprecated for written works and songs; use P407 ("language of work or name") instead.

P840.name: narrative location
P840.desc: the narrative of the work is set in this location

P57.name: director
P57.desc: director(s) of film, TV-series, stageplay, video game or similar

P750.name: distributed by
P750.desc: distributor of a creative work; distributor for a record label; news agency; film distributor

P509.name: cause of death
P509.desc: underlying or immediate cause of death.  Underlying cause (e.g. car accident, stomach cancer) preferred.  Use 'manner of death' (P1196) for broadest category, e.g. natural causes, accident, homicide, suicide

P162.name: producer
P162.desc: person(s) who produced the film, musical work, theatrical production, etc. (for film, this does not include executive producers, associate producers, etc.) [for production company, use P272, video games - use P178]

P40.name: child
P40.desc: subject has object as child. Do not use for stepchildren

P551.name: residence
P551.desc: the place where the person is or has been, resident

P937.name: work location
P937.desc: location where persons or organisations were actively participating in employment, business or other work

P6.name: head of government
P6.desc: head of the executive power of this town, city, municipality, state, country, or other governmental body

P264.name: record label
P264.desc: brand and trademark associated with the marketing of subject music recordings and music videos

P1346.name: winner
P1346.desc: winner of a competition or similar event, not to be used for awards (instead use "award received" (P166) on awardee's item, possibly qualified with "for work" (P1686)) or for wars or battles

P737.name: influenced by
P737.desc: this person, idea, etc. is informed by that other person, idea, etc., e.g. “Heidegger was influenced by Aristotle”

P138.name: named after
P138.desc: entity or event that inspired the subject's name, or namesake (in at least one language). Qualifier "applies to name" (P5168) can be used to indicate which one

P607.name: conflict
P607.desc: battles, wars or other military engagements in which the person or item participated

P159.name: headquarters location
P159.desc: city, where an organization's headquarters is or has been situated. Use P276 qualifier for specific building

P915.name: filming location
P915.desc: actual place where this scene/film was shot. For the setting, use "narrative location" (P840)

P921.name: main subject
P921.desc: primary topic of a work (see also P180: depicts)

P155.name: follows
P155.desc: immediately prior item in a series of which the subject is a part, preferably use as qualifier of P179 [if the subject has replaced the preceding item, e.g. political offices, use "replaces" (P1365)]

P1589.name: lowest point
P1589.desc: point with lowest elevation in the country, region, city or area

P706.name: located in/on physical feature
P706.desc: located on the specified (geo)physical feature. Should not be used when the value is only political/administrative (P131) or a mountain range (P4552).

P35.name: head of state
P35.desc: official with the highest formal authority in a country/state

P1923.name: participating team
P1923.desc: like 'Participant' (P710) but for teams. For an event like a cycle race or a football match you can use this property to list the teams and P710 to list the individuals (with 'member of sports team' (P54) as a qualifier for the individuals)

P206.name: located in or next to body of water
P206.desc: body of water on or next to which a place is located

P410.name: military rank
P410.desc: military rank achieved by a person (should usually have a "start time" qualifier), or military rank associated with a position

P710.name: participant
P710.desc: person, group of people or organization (object) that actively takes/took part in an event or process (subject).  Preferably qualify with "object has role" (P3831). Use P1923 for participants that are teams.

P344.name: director of photography
P344.desc: person responsible for the framing, lighting, and filtration of the subject work

P793.name: significant event
P793.desc: significant or notable events associated with the subject

P241.name: military branch
P241.desc: branch to which this military unit, award, office, or person belongs, e.g. Royal Navy

P451.name: unmarried partner
P451.desc: someone with whom the person is in a relationship without being married. Use "spouse" (P26) for married couples

P1376.name: capital of
P1376.desc: country, state, department, canton or other administrative division of which the municipality is the governmental seat

P527.name: has part(s)
P527.desc: part of this subject; inverse property of "part of" (P361). See also "has parts of the class" (P2670).

P22.name: father
P22.desc: male parent of the subject. For stepfather, use "stepparent" (P3448)

P30.name: continent
P30.desc: continent of which the subject is a part

P1532.name: country for sport
P1532.desc: country a person or a team represents when playing a sport

P1038.name: relative
P1038.desc: family member (qualify with "type of kinship", P1039; for direct family member please use specific property)

P3602.name: candidacy in election
P3602.desc: election where the subject is a candidate

P1313.name: office held by head of government
P1313.desc: political office that is fulfilled by the head of the government of this item

P1308.name: officeholder
P1308.desc: persons who hold and/or held an office or noble title

P674.name: characters
P674.desc: characters which appear in this item (like plays, operas, operettas, books, comics, films, TV series, video games)

P25.name: mother
P25.desc: female parent of the subject. For stepmother, use "stepparent" (P3448)

P749.name: parent organization
P749.desc: parent organization of an organization, opposite of subsidiaries (P355)

P1302.name: primary destinations
P1302.desc: major towns and cities that a road serves

P91.name: sexual orientation
P91.desc: the sexual orientation of the person — use IF AND ONLY IF they have stated it themselves, unambiguously, or it has been widely agreed upon by historians after their death

P1040.name: film editor
P1040.desc: person who works with the raw footage, selecting shots and combining them into sequences to create a finished motion picture

P802.name: student
P802.desc: notable student(s) of the subject individual

P725.name: voice actor
P725.desc: performer of a spoken role in a creative work such as animation, video game, radio drama, or dubbing over [use "character role" (P453) as qualifier] [use "cast member" (P161) for live acting]

P112.name: founded by
P112.desc: founder or co-founder of this organization, religion or place

P407.name: language of work or name
P407.desc: language associated with this creative work (such as books, shows, songs, broadcasts or websites) or a name (for persons use "native language" (P103) and "languages spoken, written or signed" (P1412))

P1889.name: different from
P1889.desc: item that is different from another item, with which it may be confused

P1877.name: after a work by
P1877.desc: artist whose work strongly inspired/ was copied in this item

P647.name: drafted by
P647.desc: which team the player was drafted by

P1366.name: replaced by
P1366.desc: other person or item which continues the item by replacing it in its role. Use P156 ("followed by") if the item is not replaced nor identical, but adds to the series (e.g. books in a series).

P361.name: part of
P361.desc: object of which the subject is a part (if this subject is already part of object A which is a part of object B, then please only make the subject part of object A). Inverse property of "has part" (P527, see also "has parts of the class" (P2670)).

P1066.name: student of
P1066.desc: person who has taught this person

P156.name: followed by
P156.desc: immediately following item in a series of which the subject is a part, preferably use as qualifier of P179 [if the subject has been replaced, e.g. political offices, use "replaced by" (P1366)]

P205.name: basin country
P205.desc: country that have drainage to/from or border the body of water

P485.name: archives at
P485.desc: the institution holding the subject's archives

P734.name: family name
P734.desc: part of full name of person

P1050.name: medical condition
P1050.desc: any state relevant to the health of an organism, including diseases and positive conditions

P1431.name: executive producer
P1431.desc: executive producer of a movie or TV show

P276.name: location
P276.desc: location of the object, structure or event. In the case of an administrative entity as containing item use P131. For statistical entities use P8138. In the case of a geographic entity use P706. Use P7153 for locations associated with the object.

P2348.name: time period
P2348.desc: time period (historic period or era, sports season, theatre season, legislative period etc.) in which the subject occurred

P488.name: chairperson
P488.desc: presiding member of an organization, group or body

P263.name: official residence
P263.desc: the residence at which heads of government and other senior figures officially reside

P2541.name: operating area
P2541.desc: geographic area or jurisdiction an organisation or industry operates in, serves, or has responsibility for

P2789.name: connects with
P2789.desc: item with which the item is physically connected

P84.name: architect
P84.desc: person or architectural firm responsible for designing this building

P800.name: notable work
P800.desc: notable scientific, artistic or literary work, or other work of significance among subject's works

P403.name: mouth of the watercourse
P403.desc: the body of water to which the watercourse drains

P501.name: enclave within
P501.desc: territory is entirely surrounded (enclaved) by the other territory

P53.name: family
P53.desc: family, including dynasty and nobility houses. Not family name (use P734 for family name).

P2936.name: language used
P2936.desc: language widely used (spoken or written) in this place or at this event

P170.name: creator
P170.desc: maker of this creative work or other object (where no more specific property exists)

P2515.name: costume designer
P2515.desc: person who designed the costumes for a film, television programme, etc

P2852.name: emergency phone number
P2852.desc: telephone number to contact emergency services

P1435.name: heritage designation
P1435.desc: heritage designation of a cultural or natural site

P1576.name: lifestyle
P1576.desc: typical way of life of an individual, group, or culture

P512.name: academic degree
P512.desc: academic degree that the person holds

P279.name: subclass of
P279.desc: this item is a subclass (subset) of that item; all instances of these items are instances of those items; different from P31 (instance of), e.g.: K2 is an instance of mountain; volcano is a subclass of mountain (and an instance of volcanic landform).

P1027.name: conferred by
P1027.desc: person or organization who grants an award, certification, grant, or role

P3279.name: statistical leader
P3279.desc: leader of a sports tournament in one of statistical qualities (points, assists, rebounds etc.). Don't use for overall winner. Use a qualifier to link to the item about the quality.

P740.name: location of formation
P740.desc: location where a group or organization was formed

P1365.name: replaces
P1365.desc: person, state or item replaced. Use "structure replaces" (P1398) for structures. Use "follows" (P155) if the previous item was not replaced or predecessor and successor are identical

P1075.name: rector
P1075.desc: senior official in an educational institution

P1383.name: contains settlement
P1383.desc: settlement which an administrative division contains

P3342.name: significant person
P3342.desc: person linked to the item in any possible way

P931.name: place served by transport hub
P931.desc: territorial entity or entities served by this transport hub (airport, train station, etc.)

P641.name: sport
P641.desc: sport that the subject participates or participated in or is associated with

P610.name: highest point
P610.desc: point with highest elevation in a region, or on the path of a race or route

P169.name: chief executive officer
P169.desc: highest-ranking corporate officer appointed as the CEO within an organization

P807.name: separated from
P807.desc: subject was founded or started by separating from identified object

P3179.name: territory overlaps
P3179.desc: part or all of the area associated with (this) entity overlaps part or all of the area associated with that entity

P50.name: author
P50.desc: main creator(s) of a written work (use on works, not humans); use P2093 when Wikidata item is unknown or does not exist

P135.name: movement
P135.desc: literary, artistic, scientific or philosophical movement or scene associated with this person or work. For political ideologies use P1142.

P726.name: candidate
P726.desc: person or party that is an option for an office in this election

P3448.name: stepparent
P3448.desc: subject has the object as their stepparent

P1792.name: category of associated people
P1792.desc: Wikimedia category for people associated with this place or organization

P1416.name: affiliation
P1416.desc: organization that a person or organization is affiliated with (not necessarily member of or employed by)

P542.name: officially opened by
P542.desc: person that officially opened the event or place

P545.name: torch lit by
P545.desc: person that lit the torch at an event, like the Olympic Games

P945.name: allegiance
P945.desc: country (or other power) that the person or group serves

P355.name: has subsidiary
P355.desc: subsidiary of a company or organization; generally a fully owned separate corporation. Compare with "business division" (P199). Opposite of parent organization (P749).

P505.name: general manager
P505.desc: general manager of a sports team. If they are also an on-field manager use P286 instead

P61.name: discoverer or inventor
P61.desc: subject who discovered, first described, invented, or developed this discovery or invention

P180.name: depicts
P180.desc: entity visually depicted in an image, literarily described in a work, or otherwise incorporated into an audiovisual or other medium; see also P921,  'main subject'

P748.name: appointed by
P748.desc: who appointed the person to the office, can be used as a qualifier

P1037.name: director / manager
P1037.desc: person who manages any kind of group

P144.name: based on
P144.desc: the work(s) used as the basis for subject item

P3075.name: official religion
P3075.desc: official religion in this administrative entity

P609.name: terminus location
P609.desc: location of the terminus of a linear feature

P210.name: party chief representative
P210.desc: chief representative of a party in an institution or an administrative unit (use qualifier to identify the party)

P1962.name: sponsor
P1962.desc: organization or individual that sponsors this item
